bibl.title: Letter, Alexander Forrest in Washington to John Inskeep.,1809 May 24
bibl.note: Insurance Company of North America Records, 1792 December 1-1843 February 18

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: to call and rectify any mistake
-also wrote Mr Ross to attend to it.

Inclosed is a Draft for the amt. of my Insurance which would have been forwarded on or before the 7th Inst. But obesowing in the Policy of the frame House which I Occupy on Virginia Avenue fifteen ft. from my Brick House Occupied by Mr. Craven, and fifty Seven from any other Building, and that a Brick one-Described only 18ft. front Whereas it is 36ft front. It will appear to you plain that I wou,d not Insure more than I Cou,d recover
As a House 18ft by 26 &half Stories high although well finished wou,d not Cost $1500._
I have Sent frequently to request your agent Mr. Ross to Call and have the Error Corrected But it appears he Cou,d not make it Convenient , Which is the Cause of the Delay.
